reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars My Heart Was so Happy
reviews.reviewText: I felt giggly and light the entire time of this book! At times I would laugh, at times I would cry, at times I would smack my feet on the ground because I was so excited!Such a feel good book!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Little Physical Romance but SO MUCH LOVE!
reviews.reviewText: Book Review: “The Cheat Sheet” by Sarah Adams, Tropes: Football Romance, Friends to Lovers, Fake Dating, Slow Burn, Rating: 4⭐️ & 0-1🌶️.•This book has been sitting on my bookshelves for months now and I picked it on a whim and I am so happy I did. It reminded me a lot of “The Seven Year Slip”, not plot wise, but because I was not expecting how much I enjoyed it. This was also my first football romance and first ballerina/dance-related romance books and I loved both themes. Does anyone know any other sports romance books with either football or dance as major themes? I’d love to get my feet wet and explore more!•Below are some of my favorite quotes:-“We want to know how you can be best friends with that god among men and not hit it. Ew, don’t say hit it. My business with my friend is my own, not yours. But you love him, right?”-“Every inch of me tingles with awareness, and I mentally begin mapping out every way she fits perfectly in my arms”.-“We need to kiss, on the red carpet. I can’t kiss you out there! OMG, our first kiss can’t be in front of paparazzi! Do you want me to kiss you now? No absolutely not! Well, maybe, actually yes”.-“Not my man yet. Bree, he’s been your man for years”.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Sarah's got a new fan!
reviews.reviewText: I always get nervous about friends to lovers where they're already desperately in love at the start of the book. Sometimes it seems like the book drags on. Not this one though!I don't want to spoil anything, so I'll just say that Bree and Nathan are absolutely adorable and i love their story!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars good start but not a great finish
reviews.reviewText: I couldn’t get over Bree and her childish demeanor, Nathan was okay until it got to the I’m not a virgin but wanna wait til marriage part. It’s a book I know but come on. Spice isn’t til 95% and it’s make .25 worthy of reading. This book felt to long and drawn out. 6 years of friendship and I was let down from the book by the end. The FMC was hard to get over in general but through the other actions taken by each of them, it was a big no for me.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars one of my favorite romance books
reviews.reviewText: I adore how this book progressed. I adore Bree and Nathan and the safe place they’ve always found in each other. I hope to find that in my future partner who makes me feel the same way that Nathan and Bree feel for each other.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This was such a cute read! I thought that Bree & Nathan were an adorable couple, and I loved the banter between them throughout the book. It was a long time coming but by the end, I was pretty charmed.However, the miscommunication really drove me up the wall. I can do a little bit but this was extreme. This was drawn out and every time I thought they would get together, something happened or one of them refused to see what everyone else could see. Despite frustrations with parts of the book, there were more parts that made me laugh & made me swoon. I can’t wait to read more by Sarah Adams!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Gift for daughter she loved this book
reviews.reviewText: Gift for daughter she loved this book

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars My favorite kind of cheesy romance
reviews.reviewText: I had a cheesy smile on my face during 99.9% of this book. It was cheesy but in the best way possible! Read it in 2 days because I was just waiting for the moment Nathan and Bree got together.
I’ve read this book twice now in the past year and I still love it so much. I’m so excited for the sequel!!

Vou estar mentindo se disser que não fiquei com um sorrisinho bobo no rosto durante toda a leitura.É um clichê? ÓbvioMas você não consegue parar de rir das ideias bobas mas ao mesmo tempo eficazes que esses amigos/ brutamontes/ gostosos/ jogadores profissionais tem de atitudes românticas que com certeza vão conquistar a nossa mocinha.Se prepara que lá vai um resumo da históriaBree é melhor amg de Nathan desde a escola e eles são apaixonados um pelo outro mas morrem de medo de falar algo, não serem correspondidos e a amizade acabar e por isso guardam esses sentimentos pra si mesmos até que após uma noite de bebedeira a nossa Bree acaba soltando a língua pra uma desconhecida e dá a entender que Nathan é apaixonado por ela. O grande problema? Essa desconhecida é ninguém menos que uma jornalista e no dia seguinte eles são a sensação da internet e disso tudo surge uma proposta irrecusável que envolve contrato de namoro falso.No meio de toda essa confusão Nathan vê sua grande chance de sair da friendzone e mudar o jogo a seu favor e o melhor, sem correr o risco de perder a amizade, afinal todos os toques serão pura encenação pra mídia, né !?Daí surge a grande idéia dos 5 jogadores de futebol patetas de escreverem uma espécie de livro de táticas de conquistas. Posso afirmar que agora com certeza sei porque todos estão solteiros.

It is no secret that I love all things cute and also every single thing I've ever read by @authorsarahadams so it really should come as no surprise that I loved The Cheat Sheet and wish could get my hands on a Nathan ASAP!What did I love about this book you ask? First, the P I N I N G, ooof the pining was so good friends and watching those idiots pine for each other made me wish I had a hot best friend of the male variety.Second, the banter. We all know (or maybe you don't) that I'm a woman of banter and when relationships have the right amount of it I just get suckered in. And these two had banter to spare while at the same time balancing that with a deep knowledge of each other that was just *chef’s kiss*Third, dimples. That is it, that is the tweet. Dimples. Love them.Fourth, Nathan is too sexy for his own good and has a self-sacrificial heart of love that knows how to restrain itself for love and I dig that. I want that!So, if you haven't grabbed a copy for yourself you should really get on that and then grab yourself every other book Sarah has put out because they're just that good.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 16, 2024
reviews.reviewText: What a brilliant book to read for valentines week … love love loved it xx
This book literally brought me out of the mental breakdown I was having . Loved it so very much. <3
